result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:20 AM Defendant Daniel R Kranker in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Galang is appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
